pr_title: HIVE-24241: Enable SharedWorkOptimizer to merge downstream operators after an optimization step

timeline.message: add operatorgraph fiolter stuff; fix q.outs

Revert "disable TestJdbcWithMiniKdcSQLAuthHttp"

This reverts commit c9bb4e34974da7ab5d82cfd505aab96b228f4c36.
accept q.outs; undo cleanup in vertex.java

timeline.bodyText: @jcamachor this is the checker class I was talking about - right now it builds on top of the basic digraph class I've introduce some time ago in PointLookupOptimizer
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Looks good. Could we add comments so it is clear what it is being represented, e.g., what is a cluster, etc.
replies.author: jcamachor

timeline.bodyText:
we can definetly roll our own graph representation; however sometimes I would feel that it would make things easier to have access to basic graph algorithms (for example to do a  topological order walk/etc) there is a small library called jgrapht (EPL 2.0 license - I think it will be okay) which could be utilized for these kind of things
@jcamachor what do you think about pulling in the jgrapht lib and removing the makeshift digraph classes?
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think it's a good idea to use an established graph library for this. I think we could create a follow-up for that and discuss the license too, to make sure there is no issue. Any advantage to using jgrapht over Guava graph implementation, given that guava is already a Hive dependency and quite widely used?
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText:
jgrapht has quite a few graph algorithms as well - guava would be a viable candidate if we don't yet have a graph class; but I think it doesn't give much more than that.
I've moved these classes around - let's see how far we can get with these!
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: this is not called from anywhere right now - but I've used it during debug to get a better understanding of the plan
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Can we maybe move it to a utility class and add a comment? You could maybe move all these classes to optimizer.graph package
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText:
yes; I've moved these classes - I use these methods during development; and they are very usefull; I needed to see the join tree - and I was able to extract a simple tree after a few minutes.
I plan to expose this kind of information on the hs2 web interface in some way.
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: In the meantime, maybe DiGraph could be made a top class.
timeline.author: jcamachor

timeline.bodyText: Left the comment in other class but I was thinking that it may be a good idea to promote this to top class (at least until we replace it by any other library version as we were discussing).
timeline.author: jcamachor

timeline.author: jcamachor
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2595,6 +2595,8 @@ private static void populateLlapDaemonVarsSet(Set<String> llapDaemonVarsSetLocal
     HIVE_SHARED_WORK_DPPUNION_OPTIMIZATION("hive.optimize.shared.work.dppunion", true,
         "Enables dppops unioning. This optimization will enable to merge multiple tablescans with different "
             + "dynamic filters into a single one (with a more complex filter)"),
+    HIVE_SHARED_WORK_DOWNSTREAM_MERGE("hive.optimize.shared.work.downstream.merge", true,
+        "Analyzes and merges equiv downstream operators after a successfull shared work optimization step."),

timeline.bodyText: I think you could use ExprNodeDescExprFactory.isANDFuncCallExpr or FunctionRegistry.isOpAnd(expr)?
timeline.author: jcamachor

timeline.message: be more conservative - do full check
